notes: Demonstrations relating to the inter-ethnic violence experienced 2 days prior in Blukwa also occurred in Bunia on February 5th and 6th. On the 5th, youth tried to block the passage of the governor in the central market.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Activities have been paralysed in Blukwa since the morning of February 5th, due to the tension between police and protesters, who demonstrated against the "massacre" that took place on Saturday between the Lendu and Hema communities.

actor1: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On February 3rd, inter-ethnic fighting broke out in Blukwa, around 100km from Bunia, between the Hema and Lendu militias. The attack lasted two days and at least 23 members of the Hema community were killed by Lendu (although reports differ, ranging from 23-32), 12 people were severely injured and several houses were burned during the attack on the Hema village. Police and soldiers were dispatched to the spot to prevent the spread of violence, which followed days of tension between the two ethnic communities in the region.

actor1: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On February 3rd, inter-ethnic fighting broke out in Blukwa, around 100km from Bunia, between the Hema and Lendu militias. The attack lasted two days and at least 23 members of the Hema community were killed by Lendu (although reports differ, ranging from 23-32), 12 people were severely injured and several houses were burned during the attack on the Hema village. Police and soldiers were dispatched to the spot to prevent the spread of violence, which followed days of tension between the two ethnic communities in the region.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: The ADF attacked the locality of Kitevya (40km Nord--west of Beni), pillaging a hospital and killing 3 people (2 by bullets and 1 by machete).

actor1: Rioters (South Sudan)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Tensions were registered on January 31st in the periphery of Goma between South-Sudanese ex-combatants and MONUSCO forces. The former blocked roads and pelted MONUSCO forces, demanding their departure from a camp where 370 ex-combatants are living. The MONUSCO, in turn, used tear gas on the ex-combatants.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: One person was killed by bullets after an altercation between civilians from the village of Leiko and those from Robu. The altercation led to the involvement of a police officer who ended up shooting one of the persons.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: After the police officer killed one of the people involved, the villagers from Robu started setting houses on fire.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The mayor of Beni was subjected to an attack on January 30th, when an unidentified group of men threw a grenade insider her car close to the Kilokwa market in Beni. The mayor managed to get the grenade and throw it back out before it exploded.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: Two factions of the Nduma NDC group - Renewal and Mandaima - clashed with one another in the villages of Mukaka and Kailinge, in the grouping of Ihana in Walikale. One person was killed and others were injured.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: Two factions of the Nduma NDC group - Renewal and Mandaima - clashed with one another in the villages of Mukaka and Kailinge, in the grouping of Ihana in Walikale. One person was killed and others were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Protesters held a demonstration in Kisoro on January 29th against the arrest of their LC3 Chairman Didas Muntuki. Over 500 locals gathered with their local MP at Kaku Bridge, at which point police dispersed them with tear gas and live bullets.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On January 25th, the FARDC launched an offensive against the UPLC in Kasindi-Lubiriha, 90km east of Beni. During the operation, one of the rebels was killed. A subsequent report mentions two deaths.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Thursday, January 25th, one civilian was killed and three others injured during an attack by ADF in Eringiti.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APRDC: Alliance of Patriots for the Restoration of Democracy in Congo
notes: On January 24th, the APRDC, a dissident militia from the Mayi Mayi Nyatura, occupied the locality of Muheto, in Masindi. They ransacked the local commerce and intimidated the population upon overtaking the location.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APRDC: Alliance of Patriots for the Restoration of Democracy in Congo
notes: On the night of the same day that the locality of Muheto was lost, the FARDC regained its control. After being called for reinforcement, the FARDC repelled the APRDC and retook control of the area.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 January. On 24 January, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC in Mapobu (10 km east of Oicha), killing 5 FARDC soldiers and wounding 36 others. MONUSCO provided support in evacuating the wounded.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: Two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua faced each other in the locality of Makungulano, in Walikale. They clashed due to the sharing of goods collected at the market, causing the population to flee and the activity in the locality to stop. There are two severely injured people.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC intervened after the attack in Kokola, on January 21st, and repelled the ADF.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); LUCHA: Fight for Change
notes: Arrests: On January 21st, Christians and other protesters such as LUCHA militants were arrested nationwide in Kinshasa, Goma and Beni. MONUSCO reports more than 100 arrests. ACAJ reports 247 arrests.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Nyamabo-Songolo, the rebels ransacked the population.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Tulabo, the rebels ransacked the population.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21 January. ADF launched an attack against an FARDC camp near Mayi Moya on 21 January. Causalities not known.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: Suspected Islamist Ugandan rebels (ADF) killed three civilians in Kokola on January 21st. The victims were a taxi driver and his two customers.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Mbisa, the rebels ransacked the population.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Saturday 20th, 3 FARDC soldiers were killed in a clash with ADF that took place in Nyakele, Beni.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Sukwa (report mentions Supka), the FRPI ransacked the village but was then repelled by the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Songokoi, the army intervened in order to prevent FRPI from ransacking the population.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Sasa, the rebels raped a woman and ransacked the village.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: ADF attacked 2 locations near the Uganda border on Friday 19th - the villages of Parikingi and Abialos -, resulting in the death of 4 rebels and 20 FARDC soldiers. 4 AK-47s were recovered, as well as a Motorola radio and a mortar. The attack was repelled by the FARDC, but the clash was described as being of an extremely violent nature. Fatalities split between events.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 January. ADF launched attacks on FARDC in Oicha region resulting in 12 killed FARDC soldiers and 4 ADF rebels

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: ADF attacked 2 locations near the Uganda border on Friday 19th - the villages of Parikingi and Abialos, resulting in the death of 4 rebels and 20 FARDC soldiers. 4 AK-47s were recovered, as well as a Motorola radio and a mortar. The attack was repelled by the FARDC, but the clash was described as being of an extremely violent nature. Fatalities split between events.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC resumed its bombing in Beni on Friday 19th January, in a continued attempt to target ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Security Measures: the FARDC announces the launch of a sensitisation towards disarmament campaign in Lubero, in order to promote defection from the Mayi Mayi militias. The FARDC confirms the defection of commander Nzilamba Katika of the Mayi Mayi Leopard, known by Yesu.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The headquarters of the Mayi Mayi APCLS in Matende, Lwibo, were attacked by a coalition of NDC-R rebels and APCLS dissidents on January 17th. According to local sources, at least 6 people died (2 on the NDC-R side and 4 on the APCLS) and 7 were injured (NDC-R side).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Mambaiko/Mamba Iko, expelling the ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Silimbamba, expelling the ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Sesele, expelling the ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Monday, January 15th, the ADF attacked the FARDC in Munzambayi, commune of Rwenzori, where they were repelled. According to the FARDC, 5 people were injured (3 of which seriously) and 2 weapons were seized. A later testimony reports 3 FARDC deaths.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Between January-April, report of over 10 targeted killings as well as kidnappings and looting by unknown gunmen stationed at Virunga National Park. 10 fatalities spread over four events between January and April.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord-, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Presumed FARDC attacked the ADF in the periphery of Oicha on January 13th. Shots were heard in the locality and it is suspected that the FARDC are attacking the 'death triangle' situated in between Mbau, Kamango and Eringeti. The reports are not confirmed by the military. Military forces overtook two ADF camps.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC launched, on January 13th, an offensive against the ADF in Beni and Lubero, in response to the recents attacks by the group. Gunfires and explosions were heard in Beni all throughout Saturday (13th).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC launched, on January 13th, an offensive against the ADF in Beni and Lubero, in response to the recents attacks by the group.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: January 13th, the FARDC launched an offensive in Eastern DRC. The offensive took place in the territories of Beni, Oicha and Lubero, and targeted all the armed group involved in conflict in the region, in particular the ADF.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Economic activities and traffic are paralysed in Ituri since January 12th due to the arrest of the president of the taxi association, which took place on January 11th. The protesters are composed mainly of taxi drivers and students, who have blocked streets and demand the release of the taxi association president.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An ambush from the FPRI against 8 women in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Ituri, on January 11th, was prevented due to the intervention of the FARDC.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: A dozen civilians, including a Congolese journalist, were kidnapped by the ADF in Beni, on January 11th. The rebels blocked the vehicles coming from Kasindi before taking the civilians hostage.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the night of January 11th, an unidentified group (presumed to be the ADF or the Mayi Mayi) kidnapped several people from Beni.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The 8 women who had been ambushed the FRPI were then undressed by the same FARDC military men that prevented their ambush, with one of the women being raped by one of the militaries. Earlier that day, women fish vendors going to Bavi were also taken hostage by FARDC men to transport their goods and forced to go into the forest before they were released.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: Briefly after the UPLC occupied the locality of Kipese, the FARDC repelled their attacked and reclaimed control of the location. The UPLC reportedly took refuge in a location nearby and are waiting for reinforcements to arrive in order to launch another offensive in Kipese.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ALPC: Alliance for the Liberation of Congolese People
notes: On January 10th, the FARDC repelled an attack by the ALPC in Brimu, periphery of Ingbokolo in Aru (Ituri). The attack was launched against the positions of the military in retaliation for the killing of their leader last November during a FARDC operation in the area. The clash lasted for an hour, after which the rebels fled, leaving behind an AK-47. The positions of the military in Brimu were reinforced to ensure the population's safety.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: The UPLC briefly occupied, on January 10th, the locality of Kipese, 15km away from Lubero.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: After reinforcements arrived on January 10th, the FARDC managed to expel the UPLC from Kipese, recovering control of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Unidentified armed men broke into a house in Mapendo, in Rutshuru territory, on January 10th, where they shot and killed a woman. In a nearby property, the assailants came across a policeman who shot at them. During the clash the policeman, a man and two women were killed; an infant was shot and wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On January 10th, the UPLC attacked the FARDC in Kipese, Lubero territory, and pushed them out of the village.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On January 10th, armed men identified as Mayi-Mayi Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda killed a woman in Mandje village in Walikale territory, accusing her of being a witch. The assailants looted the victim's house.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 10 January. An hour-long exchange of fire occurred at Ndrimu (location not found) between FARDC and suspected armed elements of the Armee de liberation du peuple congolais, a residual armed group associated with the Kakwa community. The group has been largely dormant, and its strength is assessed to be fewer than 50 elements.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. On 8 and 10 January, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC positions on the MbauKamango axis. Causalities not known.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified gunmen held up a motorcycle close to Katsiru in Rutshuru territory on January 10th. The assailants abducted the man and woman and stole the motorcycle.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On January 10th, the Mai-Mai Kilalo attacked the FARDC position in Lubero rural commune in the territory of the same name.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC repelled, on January 9th, an attack by the Mayi Mayi in the rural comune of Lubero. The Mayi Mayi attacked the area where the FARDC are established, clashing with the forces. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC attacked the Mayi-Mayi Mazembe position near the village of Domaine in Rutshuru territory, on January 9th. The FARDC chased the armed group out of the village.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 9th, unidentified gunmen fired at a motorcycle carrying a FARDC soldier on the Butembo-Goma road near Kibirizi locality in Rutshuru territory. The FARDC soldier retaliated and the attackers fled. In the clash, a 37-year-old civilian died after he was hit by a bullet.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR-FOCA combatants abducted eleven people who were returning from their fields close to Kahumiro village in Rutshuru territory, on January 9th. The assailants killed five men.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: The Mai-Mai Mazembe shot dead three men aged 36, 37 and 60, respectively, in Domaine, Rutshuru, on January 9th. They also shot and injured a 48-year-old man.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
notes: On January 9th, the Raia Mutomboki Elenge looted money and goods from traders who were coming back from Isangi close to Katatwa village in Walikale territory. The assailants shot and wounded two men trying to escape and forced eight men to carry the looted goods.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 08 January. On 8 and 10 January, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC positions on the MbauKamango axis. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: 4 Mayi Mayi combatants surrendered to the FARDC in Kalau, Kalingati and Kalunguta, in the territory of Beni, on January 7th. These surrenders are expected to be due to the pression exerted by the military on the militia.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 6th, the FARDC launched an offensive on the Mayi Mayi Leopards who were moving through Kalau, in Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 6th, two police officers kidnapped a 21 year old woman and 23 year old man in Butembo. They beat them and held them for 3 hours.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 5th, a 34 year old woman was killed by unidentified men in Kibati village.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 5th, unidentified armed men raided the village of Mununze, in Beni. Apart from looting the village, they kidnapped two men, for which they demanded ransoms.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: an unidentified armed group raided the offices of civil society organisations in Butembo during the night of January 4th.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 3rd, unidentified armed men killed a soldier in Mukulya neighbourhood, in Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A policeman killed a 10-year old girl in Kashuga, Masisi, on January 2nd.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 1st, NDC-Guidon and the FARDC clashed in the Mafilo mining site, in Walikale. The rebels killed one FARDC member, stole his gun and still looted civilians.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Kasongo Faction
notes: On January 1st, an 18 year old girl was killed in the village of Mpeti, in Walikale, by Nyatura Kasongo militia men.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On January 1st, the FARDC clashed with the Mayi Mayi Kilalo in Mabuya, Beni, leading to 2 deaths (one on each side).

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 31st, police arrested fourteen people who were demonstrating in a peaceful protest in Butembo, before dispersing the rest of the protesters.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 31st, the Mayi Mayi Mazembe launched an offensive against the FARDC in Kipese. There were 3 dead (2 rebels and 1 FARDC) and several wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 31st, the FARDC launched an offensive on the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kirikiri, Lubero. The attack led to one death and 3 injured on the rebels' side.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 31st, the police dispersed protesters in the Himbi neighbourhood in Goma. Due to pelting stones, the police arrested 4 of them. On the same day and in a different neighbourhood - Majengo - civilians became violent when a police officer shot a civilian. They were prevented from exerting mob justice when other policemen intervened.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police broke off, on December 31st, a LUCHA protest in Lubiriha, Beni. The protesters demanded the implementation of the New Years deal when the police intervened and injured four of them.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Reports of violence against civilians in the form of assaults with machetes owing to intercommunal violence are causing people to flee Djugu and the region of Ituri. A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord-, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 fatalities coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: Four Nyatura rebels attacked 2 men in the village of Colline, in Rutshuru, owing to a dispute over a woman. One of the victims died.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 31st, a police officer killed a 41 year old man in Majengo, Goma.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: unidentified armed men looted Braza-Chumba village, in Walikale. They were later arrested by the FARDC after these were alerted to the situation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki-Kisekelwa attacked the FARDC in the Kabalo mining site, in Walikale, on December 30th. The attack led to 4 dead (1 FARDC and 3 rebels) and 3 wounded (1 FARDC and 2 rebels).

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Early on December 30th, in Ndosho, protesters belonging to the "Congo Conscience" group started burning tires in the streets. The riot was quickly choked by the police, which arrived at the scene and used tear gas to disperse the crowd in order to return the traffic to normal condition. Some rioters were arrested by the police.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: unidentified armed men raided the Kimemi police station in Butembo on December 30th, stealing an AK-47.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC launched an offensive against the ADF in Eringiti on December 29th. 2 rebels were killed and one was captured, along with some weapons.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC simultaneously attacked the Mayi Mayi Masembe who were in the villages of Masereka and Vusitoro in Lubero, on December 29th. Several injuries were reported on the FARDC side.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 29th, the FARDC shot and killed 5 people thinking they were Mayi Mayi rebels. Among the victims were 2 women, 2 men and a 6 month old child.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Leopard)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Leopard attacked a position belonging to unidentified armed men in the village of Yambi, Beni, on December 28th.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi)
notes: The Nyatura Nzayi clashed with the Nyatura Kavumbi in Kametembe village, Masisi. 3 rebels were killed during the clash.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC clashed with the Mayi Mayi on December 28th in Kasindi Lubiriha, 90km Nord-east of Beni. 6 militia men were killed by the FARDC, as well as one soldier. The rebels left behind an AK47 and the FARDC are currently pursuing them.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A FARDC soldier killed a woman in Kasindi Vieux on December 28th.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The same group of Mayi Mayi that had attacked Rutshuru on December 25th attacked again, this time in Mutanda, on the night of December 26-27th. A young person was killed and two other civilians injured by bullets during the clash. Civil society notes that the reemergence of intercommunal conflicts led the targeting by the Mayi Mayi of the Nande community.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified armed men raided Kabuza, in Walikale, abducted a girl and a woman, and raped them.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: On December 26th, 2 Mayi Mayi Charles rebels, who had just stolen a boat for patrol, attacked the park forces in the Virunga national park. The latter retaliated with a rocket launcher, which killed the 2 rebels, along with 3 fishermen and 1 woman.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A coalition of Nyatura Kasongo, Domi and Love attacked the FARDC position in Matanda on December 26th. One 16 year old boy was killed and 2 other men were injured.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified armed men trying to rob a house were intercepted by the police in Katindo, Goma, and the clash led to three deaths.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The residence of Joseph Kabila was set on fire on December 25th, in Musienene, Lubero, by an unknown armed group (presumed to be the ADF or the Mayi Mayi). During the event, one police officer was killed.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: A man was shot dead by the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kitsambiro, Lubero, on December 25th.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Nyatura attacked the village of Yobora, in Bwito, Rutshuru, on December 25th, killing 4 people, of which a woman and 2 children. They also burned 144 houses during the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An area chief was killed on December 25th in Beni. The motives for his death are still unknown, but his death was caused after an altercation between him and his assassins.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Movement of forces: the FDLR heavily deployed military along the border after the strikes against ADF undertaken during the weekend, as a response to the growing tensions felt and in order to prevent an expansion of the conflict into Uganda.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC was attacked by the NDC Guidon in Lubero, close to Kabale. 3 soldiers and 2 rebels died during the attack.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Mazembe were attacked on December 24th by the NDC Guidon in Kasone Kimule. 3 people died (2 Mayi Mayi and 1 NDC member), and the NDC seized 2 AK-47s.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A man was killed in Kasanga, Beni, by two armed men dressed in FARDC clothes on December 24th.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Sunday, 24th, the inhabitants of Lembabo and Simbiliabo, in Bunia, lynched 2 people who were stealing.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On December 22nd, in Bunia, the members of the Kimbangist church of Sayo clashed with autochtonous civilians, wounding 6 people with machetes and stone throwing.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Ugandan army announced on December 22nd that it had undertaken a preventive strike on the positions of ADF rebels along the Uganda-DRC border, in Eringiti (8 ADF bases were destroyed: Madina, Canada, Tadia, Popoke, Makayoba, Kaynama, Ngiti and Kikingi). Air force and long-range artillery were used (operation Tuugo). This came after the establishment of a mechanism to share information on ADF with the DRC forces. On Monday 25th, the Ugandan army claimed to have killed 100 rebels.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: a former commander of the FDLR - Evariste Nizeyimana - surrendered to the FARDC on Thursday 21st, in Lubero.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: Agreement: an old commander of the FDLR-FOCA surrendered to the MONUSCO forces in Goma, on December 21st. The colonel Evariste Nizeyimana, known as 'Kiszito', is responsible for more than 80 people killed, some of them burried alive. He also orchestrated the burning of several villages, namely Buleusa, as well as the massacre in Miliki.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Djugu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The speaker of the FARDC in Ituri confirmed that 2 FARDC soldiers had been attacked by a group of inhabitants armed with machettes in the locality of Tse, Djugu, on Wednesday 20th December. Local sources inform that the soldiers had been invited by a customary chief to disperse a group of inhabitants who sought revenge. Upon arrival, they were attacked with knives and their weapons taken from them.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The MONUSCO base which had been attacked on December 7th by the ADF has now been reoccupied.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: around 60 houses were burned in the village of Lunju, in Ituri, by inhabitants coming from Walendu Pitsi. This attack occurred in the context of tensions between Lendu and Hema communities.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: On December 19th, the Mayi Mayi attacked the Ivingu location, in Lubero, in order to steal weapons. A civilian was killed alongside 4 of the assailants.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Military operations in Kaseke, Rutshure, led the FARDC to clash with the FDLR, resulting in the capture of 3 presumed FDLR kidnappers and the release of 3 student hostages. 2 AK 47 weapons were also recovered.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: after the initial tensions between Hema and Lendu in Djugu, there were several fires started during the course of the following days and police/military were deployed to address the situation. Calm returned 5 days after the death of a young man was announced by the Bahema chief.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A soldier was killed on Monday 18th in the region of Djugu.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: The Bahema chief accuses the Lendu youth of burning 28 houses belonging to the Bahema, in Blukwa, in retaliation to the burning of Thethe dwellings by members of the Nord-ern Bahema community. He also accuses them of burning a house in Resto, along with 8 motorbikes there.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Monday 18th, a young member of the Bahema community was killed by an unidentified armed group. This sparked tensions between the Lendu and Hema groups, and residents fled the area on Tuesday 19th, fearing that intercommunal conflict could happen.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: During an attack by ADF in Oicha on December 17th, a civilian was killed, alongside a soldier of the FARDC.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 17 December. The former leader of the FDLR Evariste Nizeyimana surrendered to MONUSCO in the Lubero area

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Mazembe clashed with the NDC-G on Saturday 16th in Kaheri, grouping of Musindi, causing the population to flee on Sunday 17th.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura); Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: The NGO Action Paysanne pour le Developpement (APD) denounced that the Mayi Mayi Mazembe, Nyatura and the FDLR had been carrying several human rights violations in the Bwito chiefdom of Rutshuru during the previous two weeks, namely kidnapping civilians in large numbers (one report mentions 13 in one day alone), burning villages and undertaking massacres.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)
notes: 15 December. During the month of December, Mapenzi Likuwe split from APCLS, establishing the APCLS-Renove. The split came after Mapenzi and Janvier Karairi, the APCLS leader, disagreed over mining exploitations and political pressures - Janvier was opposed to Kabila and Mapenzi was seen as easier to influence.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police violently dispersed a protest held by LUCHA in Goma, forcing some protesters into the police cars with sticks. The protesters were demonstrating against the restriction of the political space and the numerous abuses of human rights attributed to the police in Nord-Kivu.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: Mayi Mayi Simba Manu attacked the village of Mabuo, chiefdom of Babila Babombi in Mambasa, abducting 46 people abducted. Four people also died in the river when their boat capsized while trying to flee.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified attackers killed 5 people - 4 belonging to the same family - on the night of 8 December in Mulekera commune in Beni. Residents protested the following day against the violence and the rising insecurity after the attack against MONUSCO. Some burnt tyres in the street.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LDP: Liberal Democratic Party; Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A protest was held by supporters of the Liberal Democratic Party in Goma on 8 December. The police stopped the protest, arresting 4 people, including the president of the opposition LDP, Jean-Paul Lumbu Lumbu. The protesters were demonstrating against the draft law, which according to them excluded youth and women from the deputation race, owing to the representativeness threshold and bail imposed. The police used tear gas to disperse protesters; students who were close were caught in the middle of the tear gas.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified attackers killed 5 people - 4 belonging to the same family - on the night of 8 December in Mulekera commune in Beni. Residents protested the following day against the violence and the rising insecurity after the attack against MONUSCO. Some burnt tyres in the street.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
source: MONUSCO; Daily News (DRC); UN (unspecified); AFP; IRIN; Radio Okapi; Deutsche Welle
notes: An attack by suspected ADF fighters on the MONUSCO base in Semliki in Nord-Kivu in the evening of 7 December left 14 MONUSCO and 5 FARDC soldiers dead. Another 53 blue helmets were injured during the attack and reports of rebel deaths vary from dozens to 72. The attack was described by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres as a 'war crime' and the worst attack on UN peacekeepers in the organisation's recent history.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 07 December. In Semuliki, Nord-Kivu, which resulted in the killing of 15 peacekeepers from Tanzania. Forty-four peacekeepers were also injured during the attack, attributed to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF). After a lull in their activities, ADF has resumed their attacks in the area, including against civilians.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The MONUSCO forces repelled on December 7th an attack by the ADF on one of their bases along the Mbau-Kamango axis in Beni territory. 15 Dead.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 07 December. In Semuliki, Nord-Kivu, which resulted in the killing of 15 peacekeepers from Tanzania. Forty-four peacekeepers were also injured during the attack, attributed to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF). After a lull in their activities, ADF has resumed their attacks in the area, including against civilians. Civilian causalities not known.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 MSF agents were kidnapped on the morning of December 5th by unidentified armed men in Bambu, Nord-Kivu. The agents were in mission in the area.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The students of the University of Bunia burnt tyres on the road on 5 December to demand the DRC government to return the money spent on buying the land for the campus of the University. The students broke doors and windows and stole items. Police intervened to disperse them and arrested seven.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress; UNADEF: National Union of Democrats and Federalists; Filimbi Movement; OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The representative of the OCR claims that, while in detention, their militants were tortured by DRC police members. Date unclear.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An armed group broke into the MSF office on the morning of December 4th, in Mweso, and brutalised the officers there before looting equipment and money.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: Two antagonist factions of the FDLR (FOCA and CNRD) clashed on Friday 1st in Mpati, Masisi territory. The clash caused the displacement of the local population. OCHA suspended its humanitarian actions due to the instability in the region.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police dispersed protesters who were holding a demonstration in favour of the departure of President Kabila in Kasindi, on the 30th. The police also arrested 15 LUCHA militants. 2 of them who were released on 4 December claimed to have been tortured.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Rioters blocked streets and burned tires during dead city protests in Goma on 30th November. In certain areas, shots were fired. A young student was arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In Beni, police suppressed an anti-Kabila demonstration held by LUCHA members. 5 LUCHA militants were arrested and journalists were beaten and arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: During a protest against the presidency of Kabila in Furu, Butembo, on the 30th, one of the protesters was killed. The victim belonged to the citizen movement "Parlement Debout", affiliated with the UDPS.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Protesters supporting the resignation of President Kabila took to the streets of Butembo on Tuesday 28th. The protest was later stopped by the police, protesters were dispersed and 2 of them were arrested. The protest was organised by LUCHA, Filimbi, 'Parlement debout' and 'new citizenship'.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: On Monday 27th, 6 people were injured during demonstrations in Beni and Majengo (Goma).

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: On Monday 27th, 6 people were injured during demonstrations in Beni and Majengo (Goma).

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On Thursday 23rd, 5 people, including a 12 year old adolescent, were decapitated in the region of Kibirizi, in the chiefdom of Bwito, by presumably FDLR-Rude branch Rwandan soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The FARDC clashed with the ADF since Wednesday, in 3 locations in Beni (points 6, 16 and 25). A FARDC patrol got into a trap during the night, but there are not reported fatalities. The intervention from MONUSCO soldiers prevented the FARDC vehicle from being burned.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The police, supported by the military, intervened in a protest in Oicha, on Tuesday 21st, killing 1 rioter and injuring one other. The participants marched down the street, breaking and bruning during their passage, to protest the death of a 25 year old student killed on the night of the 20th presumably by the FARDC. The participants were dispersed with tear gas and real bullets. One woman died and another boy was shot in the abdomen.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A 25 year old student was killed in Tenanbo, located at the rural exit of Oicha, presumable by a member of the FARDC. His name was Kambale Kabuyaya Paulin.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: Looting: The Mayi Mayi Charles Kakule stole 33 boat motors from the fishermen in Kyavinyonge, on Sunday 19th. They demanded 95.000 congolese francs in return for each motor. The motors were robbed because the fishermen had demanded to pay the weekly extortion of 15.000 francs that had previously been demanded. The Edward lake is surrounded by militias who are impeding the fishing activities.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A clash between the FARDC and a coalition of Mayi Mayi Mazembe and Malaika took place on the 19th in the locality of Bashu, in Beni. 6 people died, of which 4 militiamen and 2 soldiers. 4 other militamen were injured. The coalition is said to be defending the Nande community.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Looting: Civil society in Ikobo, Walikale, claims that the military has since two weeks harassed civilians in the localities of Rusamambu and Muronga. Claims mention that barriers are being erected and that 500 francs are demanded each time in order to assess the camps in both localities. The claims mentions that militaries do not hesitate to demand payment of parts of crops and to torture civilians. The reports have been denied by the military.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: In Butembo, on the 15th, protesters belonging to LUCHA and Fulimbi barricated routes in the quarters of Furu and Kitulu. The police dispersed them with tear gas.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: LUCHA protesters manifested in Kasindi, Beni, on the 15th, against the electoral calendar of the presidential elections to replace Kabile. Police who had been deployed stopped the protest and arrested 14 militants.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: Police in the Democratic Republic of Congo made several dozen arrests to stifle protests. LUCHA mentions at least 27 civilians were arrested in Nord-Kivu, including 15 in Goma. 13 other activists were detained while a communique was being read in the province of Sud Kivu. The government confirms 19 arrests, comprising six in Goma, seven in Lubumbashi and six in Matadi. The Human Rights division of MONUSCO notes that there were arbitrary arrests taking place during the day, notably in Goma and Kinshasa. Human Rights Watch mentions that at least 52 people were arrested while protesting in Goma, Kasindi, Kindu, Kisangani, Kinshasa, and Idjwi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi attacked the prison of Kakwangura in Butembo on November 15th as an attempt to free their relatives. The FARDC quickly intervened and halted the assault. The death toll resulted in 3 militiamen killed and one civilian injured. The escape of prisoners was halted by FARDC's intervention.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 15, live bullets were used to disperse protesters who were demonstrating against the electoral calendar dates in the axes Kasindo-Ndosho and Mabanga-Mangengo. The police was supported by the military.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 14, a soldier was killed by the FRPI in Singo, a locality 50km from Bunia, in Ituri. The soldier was in route to his position when he was ambushed by the enemy. There was a clash and 4 minutes later he was killed and his weapon taken.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 13, a new civil group called 'Les Deboutistes' rioted at 5am in Ndosho. They blocked the main street Goma-Sake and burned tires, in protest for a militant belonging to their group whom had been arrested. This was the first demonstration by the group. The Police used tear gas to disperse the youth group.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Friday 10th, a protest took place in the University of Bunia, in which students protested against the decision to cease by the Minister of Land Affairs of ceasing the land in which the university campus is located to a trader. 16 people were arrested by the police after they intervened to stop the protest.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police fired tear gas cannisters at sudents who organised a protest in front of the University of Bunia. The students started burning tyres in front of the school to protest the decision of the Minister of Land Affairs, attributing the ownership of the concession from the UNIBU to a trader. Shortly after 10am, dozens of police dispatched to the scene. Reports mention arrested people and one student whose hand will have to be amputated after having lost a thumb.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, regained control over the km 14, 15 and 16 of the Mbau-Kamango axis in Beni, on the morning of the 3rd.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fataities spread over events.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The FARDC intercepted a group of presumed ADF fighters in Munzambayi / Mayangose.

notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fataities spread over events.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police in Beni said they had arrested nine demonstrators during a march Tuesday against President Joseph Kabila, a day after clashes in the region that left five dead. All nine were reportedly from LUCHA and protesting in the public highway without authorisation. A LUCHA campaigner stated that the police intervened shortly after the protest started, manhandling the protesters. 9 people from LUCHA were arrested by the police.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fataities spread over events.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A protest turned violent in Goma. Protesters, responding to a call from LUCHA, were demonstrating against the decision of the national election commission to hold off on elections to replace Kabila until April 2019. Activists had called for a general strike, but unrest broke out at 5am. Rioters barricaded streets and burned tires. One report mentions that rioters started attacking with knives, achetes, spears, arrows. Security forces killed at least 4 civilians and 1 police officer also died. Another report mentions that the police confirms 2 deaths, while witnesses confirm 6. The police station of Majengo was also completely ransacked before being set on fire. In Ndosho neighbourhood, the rioters held their barricades for 5 hours before the FARDC being called in to help.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fataities spread over events.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Violent clashes broke out in Beni between the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, and the ADF in Beni, over attempts to gain the control of the route that connects Kamango to surrounding localities. At least one rebel was killed. 3 soldiers were wounded and 1 is missing.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 October. FARDC and ADF fighting in Beni continues for a second day. Causalities not known.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A group of armed men attacked the Evangelical Hospital of Nyakunde. They beat a doctor, a nurse and some patients, taking also drugs and large sums of money. Around 9 to 10 people were assaulted.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC have been fighting since the afternoon of the 26th an insurgence from presumably the ADF in the city of Beni. The situation has caused some panic among the residents.

actor1: Djupajalafuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Djupagiju Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A land dispute between the residents of Djupajalafuru and Djupagiju degenerated into a fight on the 25th. One person was killed and 2 others seriously injured. Almost all of the houses on either side were looted systematically before being burned. Both villages were emptied of their residents and activities are paralysed.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: Property destruction: Several houses were burned down by Mayi Mayi Nyatura in the locality of Mirangi in Bwito, Rutshuru. The civilians fled the scene to Kanyabayonga-Lusowa.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified gunmen attacked the police office of Hoho in the night of the 22nd. The fire exchange lasted some minutes. No injuries were registered.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: 6 fishermen were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Lake Edward. Mayi Mayi Charles have been reported to be involved in harassment towards fishermen in this region.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The FARDC got into a battle with the APCLS. The fighting lasted two days.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS try to overtake the locality of Kitobo, but are repelled by the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The FARDC got into a battle with the APCLS. The fighting lasted two days.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS rebels capture the city of Ndondo in the Mwesso-Kitshanga axis.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS ambushed the military vehicle of the 3411th regiment in Kiusha, in the Mwesso-Kitshanga axis. Local police mentions 2 combatants were killed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The convoy of the operational sector of Sokola 1, of General Marcel Mbangu, was ambushed by the ADF in the Mbau-Kamanga route. 1 soldier was killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS rebels capture the city of Carton, in the Mwesso-Kitshanga axis.

actor1: M23: March 23 Movement
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: 51 members from the M23 rebel force surrendered voluntarily to the military on Tuesday.

actor1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 October. In Rutshuru, on 16 October, growing tensions between Hutu and Nande resulted in 32 houses being set on fire in Bambo village. MONUSCO deployed and relocated 28 Nande residents as a precautionary measure.

actor1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: 16 October. In Rutshuru, growing tensions between Hutu and Nande resulted in 32 houses being set on fire in Bambo village. MONUSCO deployed and relocated 28 Nande residents as a precautionary measure. It is not clear if the unrest was one sided, or against other fighters.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The police stiffled a peaceful march of the meeting of political and social forces for change before it began in Goma. 8 members were arrested and subsequently released.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A group of armed men in military uniforms killed 4 Hutu civilians and the 3 soldiers that were escorting them between Bambu and Kisheshe, in Bwito.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Protesters took to the streets in Goma, to protest against the raising of school fees, but the protest was interrupted. In breaking the protest, the police attacked protesters, severely injuring 2 of them, and hurting others. The police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: The FRPI clashed with MONUSCO in Tshanda, 10 km away from Geti, injuring according do one source 3 blue helmets, and according to the UN only 2. 2 civilians were also hurt during the clash, which lasted 15 hours.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: 5 people were killed by the Mayi Mayi militia of NDC/Renove in the village of Kabirangiriro, in the Kihondo group, in Rutshuru. The attack targetted the Mayi Mayi Nyatura and the perpetrators died.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: 11 October. A coalition of the Forces democratiques de liberation du Rwanda/Forces combattantes abacunguzi (FDLR-FOCA) and Nyatura attacked Bwiza, Rutshuru territory, killing three officers of the Congolese National Police and five civilians.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: At least 9 people were killed in the villages of Butsiri and Mirangi, in Kanyabayonga. The killings were attributed to the Mayi Mayi Mazembe. Several Hutu villagers have left the Bwito chiefdom due to the insecure climate.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: A MONUSCO base in Mamundioma, Beni, was attacked by the ADF on October 9th. It was the second attack on a MONUSCO base in less than a week. There were 2 casualties on MONUSCO's side. MONUSCO immediately deployed forces with attack helicopters in order to secure the area. One report mentions that 10 people were killed and that at least 22 are missing. 12 other soldiers were hurt.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The clashes between the ADF and FARDC result in the military positions of Nadwi, Topoke and Canada being taken by the ADF, accoding to one report. Nevertheless, the military does not confirm this, although it continues military operations in the area until it 'has full control of the situation'.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Property destruction: FARDC military personel in search of Mayi Mayi militias ransacked the radio Moto Butembo-Beni station in Masereka. They destroyed the antenna, preventing the operation of the radio. Military officials in the area say there are unaware of this. The radio condemns this as an act against freedom of expression.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
