assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Agence Congolaise de Presse; AP; Radio Okapi; Deutsche Welle
notes: At least 34 civilians, mostly ethnic Hutus, were killed with machetes and guns by about 50 Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen (which is a primarily Nande militia) in an attack on an IDP camp. The killings took place in the Luhanga area of Lubero. Another report claimed one of those killed was a police officer.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked a police station in Kyondo and kidnapped a police officer who later escaped.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: FARDC forces reclaimed the towns of Butuhe and Rwaha from the UPLC. They claimed that one soldier was killed and another injured, while 4 attackers were captured during the operations.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: FARDC forces reclaimed the towns of Butuhe and Rwaha from the UPLC. They claimed that one soldier was killed and another injured, while 4 attackers were captured during the operations.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Manu)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Mayi Mayi Manu militiamen injured 2 police during an incursion into the Talisa Anani area of Mambasa, during which they looted property from the village.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The citizen movement "Filimbi" took streets in Bunia, to recall the end of the term of Joseph Kabila in December. The police dispersed the crowd within minutes of their gathering. Three of them were arrested.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The people of Nyamilima took the streets to protest against the abduction of a Catholic religious. The demonstration paralyzed activities in Nyamilima.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: In Goma, some 20 protesters tried to set up barricades on the main road of the city, but were dispersed by police launching tear gas.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Catholic Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A Catholic religious was kidnapped in the morning by armed men in military uniform between Kisharo and Katwiguru, in Rutshuru territory, about a hundred kilometers from Goma.

actor1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: Following the attack in Kyoto, Hutu people have retaliated by burning two houses of Nande in Bwambali village. No casualties reported.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: More than three hundred soldiers carried a sit-in at the 34th military region base in Goma to demand payment of their salaries. Some claim to be unpaid for 3 years and other demanding 11 months of pay.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
assoc_actor_1: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Clashes between members of the Nande and Hutu communities. A group of suspected Mai Mai Mazembe, close to the Nande community, set on fire several houses belonging to members of the Hutu community, in the village of Kyoto. According to the civil society, six people were killed and several houses burned during the attacks in Kyoto and Luhanga.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Armed Forces of the DRC (FARDC) regained control over Tshanika in Virunga Park at the end of fighting with the Mai-Mai militia who occupied it for six months. The FARDC launched the assault in the morning and after 8hours fighting, the Mai Mai militia moved from Tshanika and Kasindo.

actor1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: During the weekend, Mayi-Mayi Mazembe attacked the village of Kyoto while young Hutu made an incursion to Luhanga. According to the civil society, six people were killed and several houses burned during these two attacks.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 4 police have been killed over the last few weeks (reported on Nov.24) in the Butembo area of Rutshuru by unidentified Mayi Mayi militiamen.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Saturday, November 12, Rwandan soldiers reportedly killed a Congolese youngster for illegally crossing the border between the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda. The act incited protest by other youths in Goma who attempted to move into Rwanda, but the police was able to calm the situation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 11th, the FARDC clashed with the M23 movement in Sarambwe, 30km to the south of Ishasha, forcing M23 into retreat. The M23 elements were said to have infiltrated the locality the day before.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The citizen movement Filimbi held a sit-in in Bunia to protest against the mayors decision prohibiting political demonstration. Police dispersed the crowd and the coordinator, Me Naguy Godhi, was detained a few hours later by police before being released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: A attack against peacekeepers of the Indian contingent of the UN Mission Democratic Republic of Congo has killed a 7 year-old girl and wounded 32 peacekeepers and two civilians when explosion has been detonated remotely before 6:30 local time (4:30 GMT) Kyeshero, in Goma. The source added that the "home-made" device went off while the militaries were exercising. The nature of the blast in unknow and, earlier, some source said the explosion of a grenade was pulled accidentally by a peacekeeper in training and two of them, along with a girl, died.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: According to U.N. officials and witnesses, following the explotion in a UN camp, an angry demonstration sparked and was dispersed by tear gas.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least seven people were killed and eight injured Monday in aattack attributed to a Congolese militia in the village of Butalika, in the territory of Lubero.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The Rally for Change opposition coalition in Nord-Kivu staged a sit-in as the police for prohibiting them from holding their meeting in Goma on Saturday [5 November] when the guests had already entered the hall.

actor1: UPC: Union of Congolese Patriots
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Ten rebels of the Union of Patriots for the release and two Congolese soldiers were killed Nov. 4 at clashes in Mambasa territory in Ituri. The assault was launched simultaneously by the Congolese military against the villages Sun City, Makamanda, Kanyabundi, Pangoy, Kitembo and Luluwa Pumuzika.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Armed Forces of the DRC (FARDC) have taken since Thursday, November 3 in the morning control of the hill Mount Carmel, about 3 kilometers from the center of Butembo, where camped for several days followers of the sect "Body Christ".

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A day "dead city" enacted in memory of the civilians killed on Monday during an attack by suspected ADF, in Kitevya. Schools, markets and shops remained closed in Oicha, capital of Beni territory in Nord-Kivu.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Two more bodies of civilians were found Wednesday in Tenambo, a town near Kitevya.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Manu)
notes: Mayi Mayi Manu militiamen are accused of "committing many atrocities" against the population of Mambasa, causing about 800 people to seek shelter in the Bafwasende area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Three militia Mai Mai were killed in the rural commune of Mangina in Beni (Nord-Kivu) during a clash with police. Clashes have resulted from the arrest of a group of militiamen who tattooed young people of the town.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Six civilians were hacked to death when fighters from the Ugandan Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) attacked with machetes the village of Kitevya, in Nord-Kivu province.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In Busendo in Rutshuru, three bikers were abducted around 30 km from Kiwanja by armed bandits.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Non-violent activity: The headquarters of citizen Front 2016 was stormed by the Congolese National Police (PNC) who prevented its members from holding a rally to demand respect for the Constitution, those organizations denounce the rights of the man. The Deputy Mayor of Bunia said that the decision to ban any manifestations was taken following the events recorded in Kinshasa on 19 and 20 September.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The security forces dispersed the protesters in Goma, questioning eight demonstrators, the majority of the Struggle for Change (LUCHA).

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: A top commander of the FDLR, Habiarimana Mucebo Sofuni, was captured in the Rutshuru area. It was not clear if he was among those captured on Oct.23.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 4 FDLR rebels were killed and 2 others captured after an attack by Congolese soldiers on an FDLR safehouse in the Rutshuru area.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Families from Butembo and Maboya staged a sit-in in Beni to demand the return of the bodies of children they believe were killed during a clash in Kabasha between Congolese soldiers and Body of Christ militiamen.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: ADF rebels and Congolese forces clashed in the Mayi Moya area. 3 civilians were killed during the incident.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Arrests: Col Mucebo Sofuni Habyarimana, a senior member of the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda, a rebel group that includes members accused of carrying out the 1994 genocide in Rwanda, was arrested in Kiwanja, a village located about 75 kilometres Nord- of Goma, capital of Nord-Kivu and transferred to Goma for questioning.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 more Body of Christ militiamen were killed in continued clashes today with Congolese soldiers in the Kabasha hill area.

actor1: PRFI: Patriotic Resistance Forces of Ituri
notes: 19-23 October. From 19 to 23 October, suspected FRPI elements raided eight villages on the Bunia-Beni axis, during which at least one civilian was wounded. Exact locations not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
source: Radio Okapi; Agence Congolaise de Presse
notes: At least 11 militiamen were killed in violent clashes between Congolese soldiers and Body of Christ Mayi Mayi militiamen. The clash occurred at Kabasha hill where about 100 fighters were gathered. 1 FARDC soldier was injured during the clash and many were arrested after.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: Beni and Butembo saw small protests of aroud 50 people each to mark the protest strike called by the OCR and to demand the departure of President Kabila.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: Beni and Butembo saw small protests of aroud 50 people each to mark the protest strike called by the OCR and to demand the departure of President Kabila.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: Goma partially followed the OCRs "dead city" protest strike, with traffic normal but many shops remaining closed. 200 people also demonstrated to demand the departure of President Kabila.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 FRPI militiamen and a Congolese soldier were killed in a clash in the Mukrio area. The FRPI militiamen had attacked a FARDC position.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 4 militiamen and 2 others were killed during a clash between Congolese forces and Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen in the Kanyaboibi area of Ituri.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: FRPI militiamen raided Ngasu village in the Irumu area. The attackers fired several shots into the air before looting property, including livestock and vehicles. FARDC soldiers who were based nearby intervened and attempted to pursue the militiamen but there was no report of a clash.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Members of a new self-defense (Mayi Mayi) militia "Body of Christ" took up arms in the Mutiri neighbourhood of Butembo and were allegedly planning to go to Beni to protect against the ADF. As they were arming themselves with machetes, slingshots and arrows, FARDC soldiers intervened and opened fire on them, leading to a clash that resulted in 3 fatalities. 2 of those killed were civilians who were reportedly hit by stray bullets, while one soldier also died. A different source said 2 soldiers and 3 civilians were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A clash broke out between FARDC and South Sudanese armed forces in Kengezi base, a Congolese locality along the border, after FARC soldiers disarmed a South Sudanese soldier who had crossed into DR-Congo. When they refused to turn over the soldier, who was wounded, the South Sudanese forces accused them of collaborating with rebels and attacked. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: Movement of forces: Armed men in UPDF uniforms with "major engines of war" were seen operating in the Watalinga sector of Nord-Kivu (close to the border) with villagers saying they disappeared into Virungu National Park.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: At least 7 civilians were killed, 5 by gunshot and 2 by machete, in an attack by suspected ADF rebels Nord-east of Beni. 2 people were also injured and three houses and a school burnt down. FARDC soldiers intervened, and one soldier and 2 attackers killed in the ensuing fight.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A young girl was injured by a machete and three houses burnt down during an attack on Kashalira village in Rutshuru by 7 Nyatura militiamen. FARDC soldiers arrived to repulse the militiamen who were allegedly looking for a particular person who they were unable to locate, which led to the outburst of violence.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: A young girl was injured by a machete and three houses burnt down during an attack on Kashalira village in Rutshuru by 7 Nyatura militiamen. FARDC soldiers arrived to repulse the militiamen who were allegedly looking for a particular person who they were unable to locate, which led to the outburst of violence.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: At least 7 civilians were killed, 5 by gunshot and 2 by machete, in an attack by suspected ADF rebels Nord-east of Beni. 2 people were also injured and three houses and a school burnt down. FARDC soldiers intervened, and one soldier and 2 attackers killed in the ensuing fight.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: ADF rebels killed 2 people in a raid on Alungupa about 10km away from Beni.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Angry youths ransacked the HQ of FONER in Mahagi in Ituri after a promised rehabilitation project was found to have not yet been started despite FONER saying it had already spent $39m USD.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Suspected ADF rebels killed one person, seriously injured another, and abducted several in raids on Mayangose and Kasinga in Beni territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 people have been kidnapped in the Ishasha area of Rutshuru since the beginning of October (reported on Oct.9).

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Suspected ADF rebels killed one person, seriously injured another, and abducted several in raids on Mayangose and Kasinga in Beni territory.

notes: 02-04 February - Suspected ADF elements attacked the villages of Kasinga, Malolu and Mamudioma, reportedly killing four civilians and injuring three

actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Congolese soldiers repulsed attacks by FRPI militiamen on the Tarama and Mulandi villages in the Walendu Bindi area of Ituri. The militiamen did manage to loot shops and steal money during the raid, which resulted in injuries to a child.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen loot shops and steal money during a raid in the Tarama and Mulandi villages in the Walendu Bindi area of Ituri, which resulted in injuries to a child.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A number of notables from the eastern DR-Congo engaged in a sit-in in front of the provincial governors office to demand the relocation of alleged South Sudanese rebels loyal to Riek Machar who have been staying in a camp in the Nyiragongo territory close to Goma.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The OCR declared 3-days of mourning starting on Sept.27 to remember all those who have been killed in the Beni area over the last two years. Most of the city was shut down.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 4 ADF rebels and 3 Congolese soldiers were killed in a clash in the Nyaleke area of Beni territory. A conflicting report said that some of those killed were civilians instead.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 people allegedly died after a drunken soldier in civilian clothes began firing into the air in Beni, causing a panic among the population who believed the firing was from an ADF attack. 15 people allegedly drowned while trying to escape the area, while 2 were killed due to heart attacks.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: "Three INGO national staff members were abducted on the Kinyandonyi-Rugarama road in Nord-Kivu when their vehicle was ambushed by unknown armed assailants."

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 7 people were killed in an overnight attack by suspected ADF rebels in the town of Rwenzori in the Kasinga area. 15 houses were also reported burned. FARDC soldiers intervened to stop the violence.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Hundreds of opposition activists demonstrated in Beni under the supervision of national police. The activists were responding to the call of the Rally to demonstrate against the election delays. A number of injuries were reported in Beni.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Barricades were raised and a march was taken out in Goma by activists of opposition political parties and some citizen movements to the INEC office demanding the end of the presidential term on Dec.19 during ongoing protests across the DRC called by the OCR. Police were present during the events, and a number of injuries were also reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Congolese forces regained control of 4 villages from a Mayi Mayi coalition operating in the Mabasa territory. These villages were Bavaidu, Balika, Bazama, and Basiri. 67 militiamen were captured during the operations that led to the recapture of the villages, which have been ongoing for about 2 weeks.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 2 FRPI militiamen were killed and 3 captured during a clash on Saturday night with Congolese soldiers in Ofay village in the Itrui area.

notes: 2 people were killed and several are missing after a suspected ADF attack on Kididiwe near Beni. Houses and motorcycles were also reportedly burned. 4 other people were killed by suspected ADF rebels in the Malolu area of Beni territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 people were reported kidnapped in the Rutshuru area in September (2 coded in other events).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A landowner was attacked by protesting residents of the Djidda area of the Walendu Djatsi chiefdom in Djugu territory who were angry over occupation of their lands.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A soldier was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Nyamilima.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A truck driver was kidnapped in the Ngombe area of Rutshuru, near Nyamilima.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A trader was kidnapped in the Nyakakoma area and a ransom demanded.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An inspector from the Bunia Military Prosecutor (Ituri), a captain of the sub-police station Mungwalu and a civilian were wounded in an attack on two vehicles by gunmen on September 10 on axis Bunia-Mahagi road.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Congolese forces fight with Mayi-Mayi militias for control of four Mabasa territory. These villages were Bavaidu, Balika, Bazama, and Basiri.

notes: Congolese forces fight with Mayi-Mayi militias for control of four Mabasa territory. These villages were Bavaidu, Balika, Bazama, and Basiri.

notes: Congolese forces fight with Mayi-Mayi militias for control of four Mabasa territory. These villages were Bavaidu, Balika, Bazama, and Basiri.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Azize Kahindo Balikwisha, head of Isale-Bulombo group in Beni (Nord-Kivu), was killed Tuesday evening by an unidentified armed group.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 civilians were killed during clashes between Congolese soldiers and Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen in several villages in the Walikale area. The violence was a continuation of clashes between the two groups which started the day before.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 humanitarian workers from the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) were kidnapped in the late afternoon in Mashinga, in Masisi (Nord-Kivu) on their way to a humanitarian mission to Kalembe. Police sources said the kidnappers demanded the payment of a ransom of $1,000 each before their release. Nyatura would be the perpetrators. If the membership of the captors is proved, this kidnapping would be considered a violation of the act of commitment signed in August by Nyatura and APCLS militias to end insecurity.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked an army position near Kateku in the Walikale area leading to a clash.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The military regain control of the Muchacha mining area in Okapi from Mayi Mayi Simba. A soldier was killed in the battle.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A 5-vehicle convoy traveling along the Bunia-Mahagi road, including FARDC soldiers, was ambushed by unidentified gunmen at Panduru bridge about 20km from Mahagi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 people were killed and at least 5 wounded in an attack on the largely Hutu inhabited Kyuto village in Lubero by Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen which was opposed by FARDC. The militiamen also burned at least 50 houses before being repulsed by Congolese soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Several villages, including Kambi ya Miba, Totolito and Mbau, about 40km Nord-east of Beni, have been recaptured by Congolese forces. A FARDC colonel claimed that 70 casualties had been taken in one day to capture Kambi ya Miba. No other casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Several villages, including Kambi ya Miba, Totolito and Mbau, about 40km Nord-east of Beni, have been recaptured by Congolese forces. A FARDC colonel claimed that 70 casualties (not clear whether any fatalities) had been taken in one day to capture Kambi ya Miba. No other casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 6 FDLR rebels were killed and 5 captured during an operation which lasted from Aug.25-31 in the Bwito area of Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: 3 people were killed and many abducted in an attack by Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen near a mining site in the Muchacha area of Mambasa. The attackers engaged in systematic looting of the area, used the hostages to transport the goods, and raped 4 women who were also kidnapped.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: Local sources reported that a unit of the Ugandan army has established its position in recent weeks in the locality of Tshogo in the full gorilla reserve of Sarambwe in Rutshuru (Nord-Kivu). No incidents were reported while the agenda of the soldiers remains unknown.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A trader and his wife were wounded by gunfire in the Mirindi area when armed men wearing military uniforms broke into their house and robbed them.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Youth demonstrators threw stones while police used aerial firing to disperse them in Butembo following the killing of two women by a self-defense militia after they were accused of being members of the ADF. At least 57 people were allegedly arrested in relation to the killings and subsequent rioting.

actor1: Butembo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Youth members of a self-defense militia in Butembo captured two women who had just arrived in the town by mini-bus and burned them alive after accusing them of being ADF rebels.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A man was burned alive by residents of Butembo after he was accused of being a member of the ADF.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The "dead city" protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was well-attended in Goma.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
source: Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Radio Okapi
notes: Agreement: The APCLS and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militia, two groups active in Masisi, have signed a peace agreement, committing to end kidnappings in the area and returning police stations occupied by the militias. The agreement was negotiated with the help of MPs from the Masisi area and the security forces. They also agreed to disarm and hand their weapons to the Congolese military.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Young people from various civic movements, civil society organizations and political parties, including the UDPS, protested in Beni to demand "the immediate resignation" of President Kabila and the government.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 2 people were killed in a machete attack by suspected ADF rebels in the Kiteya and Makulu areas, 20km from Beni. 6 others were wounded, while 7 houses were burned down and 4 motorcycles torched.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After police arrested 13 Hutu traveling from Masisi to Bunia in Butembo for possessing machetes and axes in their luggage, young people in Butembo gathered and demanded access to the defendants. The police dispersed them with aerial firing, injuring a demonstrator. The youths then barricaded major roads in Butembo with burning tires and marched on the residence of the mayor of Butembo before again being dispersed by police and FARDC personnel.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A man was beaten to death by youths who took him for a thief. The police were able to save the man as the youths were attempting to burn him alive, but he later died in hospital.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Residents of Beni and Butembo protested in the night of Aug.19 against the curfews that have been called in their two cities following violent protests on Aug.17. Police attempted to disperse the protesters but were unable given the large numbers.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Residents of Beni and Butembo protested in the night of Aug.19 against the curfews that have been called in their two cities following violent protests on Aug.17. Police attempted to disperse the protesters but were unable given the large numbers.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In response to an attack on Bwalanda by Nande and Hunde, Hutu residents of Nyanzale burned most of the remaining Nande/Hunde houses in the town (rioting had led to arson attacks earlier in the week).

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: People marched from Butembo to Beni to protest against insecurity in their territory. Once they arrived these protesters were blocked outside the city by security forces while clashes occurred in Beni between protesters and security forces there (it was not clear if these protesters became involved in the clashes between protesters and police in Beni).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Arrests: 80 ADF rebels were arrested in Beni territory by FARDC in connection with the capture of an Imam who was engaged in youth recruitment in the area.

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hunde Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 Hutu residents of Bwalanda were killed when Nande and Hunde groups from the Nyanzale area went to the village and burned houses belonging to Hutu. The body of one of those killed was found the next day.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Thousands of demonstrators protested in Beni against insecurity in their territory following the killing of more than 40 civilians by suspected ADF rebels in Rwangoma and a smaller attack in Mayi moya the day before. The protesters raised barricades and clashed with police who used tear gas to attempt to disperse them, and later soldiers who reinforced them. At least 2 people, including a protester who died of a gunshot wound and a police officer, were reported killed and 5 wounded in the violence. At least some of those injured were hit by gunshots.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Hunde Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: After the bodies of 3 Hutu residents of Nyanzale were found dead, Hutu in the area rioted and burned the houses of Nande and Hunde in the area who they accuse of being behind the killings.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A woman accused of being part of the ADF was beaten to death and had her body set on fire by residents of Beni during protests against ADF attacks in the territory.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 3 people were killed in an attack by suspected ADF rebels in Mayimoya in the Oicha area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 members of the Catholic NGO Caritas were kidnapped as their convoy passed through the Mpati area of the Bashali-Mokoto grouping in the Masisi area. A second vehicle escaped although it was fired upon, resulting in wounds to a German journalist. The hostages were later released after a ransom was paid.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 6 FDLR rebels and 14 local fighters aligned with the FDLR were killed during clashes with Congolese soldiers during August as part of the Sokola II operation (the 6 rebel deaths coded in another event). 10 fighters were also arrested and 7 others were sent to the UN mission.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 Hutu residents of Nyanale were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi militiamen from their fields near Nyanzale. They were allegedly found dead in Katwe, near Nyanzale, a few days later.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Official sources claim at least 42 civilians were killed (civil society sources in Beni say 51) with machetes by suspected ADF rebels in an overnight attack on the Rwangoma neighbourhood of the territory.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Official sources claim at least 42 civilians were killed (civil society sources in Beni say 51) with machetes by suspected ADF rebels in an overnight attack on the Rwangoma neighbourhood of Beni territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: Arrests: The commander of the FDLR-FOCA was captured by FARDC at Katiru in Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: FARDC soldiers backed by MONUSCO have engaged in clashes with ADF rebels in the south Eringeti area since the beginning of an operation against them on Aug.8, which has resulted in an unconfirmed number of ADF rebels killed (coded as 10). 3 soldiers were also killed, and another 3 wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 11 FARDC soldiers and a MONUSCO peacekeeper were wounded during operations against ADF rebels in the Beni area. A helicopter dispatched to recover the wounded came under fire and had to turn back. They were successfully evacuated the next day.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Youths from the Masisi area have set up roadblocks on the road between Masisi and Goma in order to prevent humanitarian work in the area, which contains 30 IDP sites. They accused the NGOs of not living up to the expectations of the population, lacking transparency in their use of funds, and having failed to recruit enough local staff.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: 03 - 08 August. Five Hutu, two Hunde and 11 Nande civilians are killed by Mayi-Mayi groups (mainly Mayi-Mayi Mazembe and Mayi-Mayi Nyatura) in Kibirizi. Seven of the civilians were killed on 07/08, though the exact date(s) of the remaining fatalities are not known. 18 fatalities spread over 6 events between 3 and 8 August.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: A suspected member of the Mazembe Mayi Mayi militia was killed by Nyatura fighters.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 7 civilians were killed in an attack on Kibirizi by Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen. Congolese forces arrived during the attack and fought them off.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: At least 7 people were killed and hundreds of homes burned in a raid allegedly by FDLR-Nyatura coalition militiamen on Kibanda.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: Property destruction: Mayi Mayi militiamen set fire to the Ngoroba IDP camp in the Mazembe area of Rutshuru. The inhabitants fled the area and no casualties were reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A soldier and a civilian were killed by unidentified assailants in Kahunga.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were found dead in the Nyanzale area of Kibirizi, at least one of the bodies was that of a Nyatura fighter who had been burned alive in his home.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 4 civilians were killed by unidentified gunmen in the Kashalira area.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Hundreds of miners took to the streets in Mungwalu, in the Bunia area, to protest the killing of a miner, allegedly by the police who were pursuing her over a small debt. The miners attacked a police station causing the police to flee, but they later returned and fired shots into the air to disperse the protesters.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 04 August. MONUSCO was directly targeted on August 4 when suspected Allied Democratic Forces elements fired a rocket-propelled grenade round towards the MONUSCO base in Semliki. As a result of the sustained pressure from the operations, Allied Democratic Forces elements continued to move Nord-, including into Ituri province.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: A Mayi Mayi militia killed an IDP in the Kibirizi area.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A miner was allegedly killed by police after being pursued by them for a minor debt in Kpangba, in the Bunia area.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Congolese soldiers re-occupied the Mwalika area, an ADF stronghold whose population had been forced to grow food for them, without a fight.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A military magistrate was beaten by the personal guard of the commander of the Sokola 1 operation after the magistrate ordered the arrest of two Sokola 1 soldiers for allegedly trying to steal a large amount of military rations which were found in their homes. He was also held by the military intelligence service for 4 hours before being released.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 7 people were killed in an attack by the ADF on Oicha, which was repulsed by Congolese soldiers and MONUSCO peacekeepers. Among those killed were 2 civilians, 3 attackers and 2 soldiers. A MONUSCO peacekeeper was also wounded and 3 ADF rebels captured.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A position of the army was attacked by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Charles Kakule. The militiamen forced the military out of their camp and wounded a woman. A soldier is also MIA after the action. The military re-occupied their position after the events.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Mayimbi, near Aveba, killing a woman.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Fangasa, near Aveba, killing a woman accused of collaborating with FARDC and looted property.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Movement of forces: The Congolese army and MONUSCO launched a military operation, named "Kiboko 3" against the FRPI in south Irumu, including the use of air support.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked a passenger vehicle in the Matafa area of the Walendu Bindi chieftancy, injuring at least 3 traders and stealing goods.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 people were killed by unidentified assailants using machetes in the Bwalanda area of Nord-Kivu. At least 3 were burned to death in their homes.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 3 people were killed, including a civilian, in a clash between the APCLS and Raia Tujigemeye Nyatura groups in Butale. The APCLS managed to dislodge the Raia Tujigemeye group from the village.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Raia Tujigemeye)
notes: A newly created "Nyatura" militia, Raia Tujigemeye, has occupied Butale in the Bashali Mokoto grouping.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A civilian accused of colluding with those responsible for a recent attack on Kibirizi was stoned and killed by Kibirizi youths.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Kasongo Faction
notes: Two Nyatura militias, one led by Colonel Kasongo and the other by General Benjamin, clashed in the Kivuye area of Bashali Mokoto following the pullout of FARDC from the area. One of the militias managed to caputre the area from the other.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 people were killed, including at least 6 members of the Nande ethnic group, and 5 others wounded when suspected Nyatura-FDLR coalition fighters (also described as armed Hutu) attacked the Nande population of the Kibirizi area of Rutshuru. Huts were also reportedly burned down. Some sources described the event as a clash between Hutu and Nande, although civilians appear to have made up all the fatalities. The attack was allegedly in response to an attack by Nande on Hutus on Jul.17. FARDC soldiers intervened to end the fighting.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

notes: At least 4 Hutu were killed during an alleged attack by armed Nande on the Hutu population of the Kibirizi area of Rutshuru.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 50 people, including the South African contingent of MONUSCO and members of the Volunteer Association of the Congo (ASVOCO), took part in a peace march in Goma ahead of Nelson Mandela Day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Okapi National Park
notes: One assailant was killed and others injured in Katala, Mambasa in a clash between park rangers and poachers who were allegedly attempting to kidnap the territorys administrator and employees of an NGO. Both LRA rebels and South Sudanese soldiers are known to poach in DR-Congos national parks.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR forces attacked a FARDC position in the Tongo-Rusheshe area of Rutshuru territory, resulting in 1 soldier and 1 FDLR rebel dead and 2 others injured. The FARDC soldiers were forced into a temporary withdrawal which allowed the FDLR rebels to burn their camp before the soldiers were able to return with reinforcements the next morning.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: A coalition of three Mayi Mayi militias (Simba, Mangalibi and Simon) have occupied the mining area of Muchacha in the Okapi Wildlife Reserve in Ituri territory.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: Fighting was reported between NDC-R and Nyatura forces in the Buluma area of Rutshuru.

notes: 17 people were abducted by 10 FRPI militiamen during raids on the localities of Mandibe 1 and 2 near Komanda in Ituri territory. A man was shot and two women raped during the assault.

actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Fighting has been reported between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyanzale area, leading to displacement.

notes: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftancy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
source: Xinhua; Radio Okapi; Local Source; AFP
notes: 9 civilians were killed by suspected ADF rebels in the Tenambo, Nzanza and Mamiki localities of Oicha. A secondary source claims the attack may have instead occurred on 05/07.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Following a death of a prisoner in the custody of the Congolese national police, residents of Kafe burned the offices and buildings belonging to members of the security forces. They also took three women police officers and their dependents hostage, saying they will be released once the cause of the prisoners death was clarified.

actor1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
notes: The NDC-R and NDC-C militias clashed in the Mironge and Taka villages of Mutongo locality. 2 NDC-R fighters were reported killed during the clash.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Unidentified gunmen raided Kailenge village in the Walikale area. During the attack they clashed with FARDC soldiers who forced them to retreat. One soldier was wounded in the battle.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified militiamen raided Sidabo village in the Walendu Bindi area. A woman injured during the raid later died of her injuries.

actor1: NDRC: National Council for Democratic Renewal
notes: Change to armed group: A new rebel group composed of former M23 and FDLR-FOCA/RUDI faction fighters, called the National Council for Democratic Renewal (NDRC), has been formed in the Rutshuru area, specifically in and around the Bwito Chiefdom. Le Potentiel reported that they are planning a major attack on Butembo.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: Looting: A Mayi Mayi group from Nord-Kivu raided the Muchacha mining area, demanding food from the miners working there before leaving the area.

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers regained control of Peti village from NDC-R fighters who withdrew without a fight.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

notes: At least 7 NDC-R militiamen were killed and 11 others wounded in a clash with South African MONUSCO peacekeepers and FARDC soldiers in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. They were allegedly trying to prevent food distribution to IDPs.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: A woman was killed in the fields of the village of Biinja in the Kalembe area by FDLR-Nyatura coalition fighters.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 16 June. MONUSCO troops engaged Mayi-Mayi elements who had been trying to impede the distribution of food by humanitarians to internally displaced persons, resulting in the death of nine Mayi-Mayi elements.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 85 people have been kidnapped from Goma since the beginning of 2016, many of whom (specifically young men) have allegedly been sold to rebels groups, specifically the ADF, who in turn sell them to other "Muslim groups" based on the reports of Lets Uproot Human Trafficking, an NGO based in the Eastern DRC.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 14 FARDC soldiers and 37 ADF rebels have been killed in operations against the ADF since May (the deaths of 6 ADF rebels and 1 soldier coded in another event). 15 other rebels were captured, along with weapons and ammunitions and some roadside bombs. MONUSCO supported FARDC in these operations. One of the ADF rebels killed was the 2nd in command of the group (killed on June 13, coded in another event).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: A Mayi Mayi militia has moved into the area near Lake Edward following a withdrawal of FARDC soldiers. They are reported to have been attacking the population, including shooting a young man for refusing to pay a toll to access the lake.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 6 ADF rebels and 1 FARDC soldier were killed in a clash between the Kokola and Parking areas. At least 2 soldiers was also wounded and 2 ADF rebels captured. Artillery fire was heard during the clashes. The deputy commander of the ADF, Hood Lukwago, was among those killed.

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 people were killed and 3 wounded in clashes between the Nande and Hutu communities due to the alleged kidnapping of a Nande by Hutu in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. 5 of those killed were Hutu IDPs while 1 Nande was also reported killed and an IDP camp burned. The violence was allegedly also related to reports that FDLR combatants were active in the IDP camp in the area.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR rebels have engaged in "abuses against the indigenous peoples" of the Buleusa area in Walikale territory recently after moving into the area. At least one person was reported killed on Jun.13.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 NDC-C fighters were killed, one wounded, and 3 captured during actions as part of Operation Sokola 2 over the weekend in Walikale territory. One of those killed was allegedly the deputy leader.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: FRPI militiamen raided the village of Apinzi in Basili chiefdom in the Ituri area. They fired their guns into the areas, stole livestock, killed other animals, and attempted to kidnap the head of the village but did not succeed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 soldiers were arrested after allegedly raping 2 minor girls who had been serving them at a bar in the Biakato area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Armed assailants stole money and phones from a dozen women in Basalolo in the Bunia area. The attackers also stole other property, kidnapped 4 women and wounded a man with a machete.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
notes: Prisoners at a Bunia prison held a protest over the death of one of the inmates due to illness. FARDC soldiers were deployed to prevent a breakout, and fired into the air to disperse the protest. During the incident, at least 6 inmates were injured but it was not clear how the injuries came about.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: The headless body of a young man was found in the Nyakunde area of Ituri. ADF rebels are reportedly suspected due to the method of execution.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: The Nyatura-APCLS coalition occupied Kahira after FARDC soldiers withdrew from the locality.

notes: After ADF rebels killed 2 teachers, FARDC soldiers intervened and killed 2 ADF rebels before driving them off. Another civilian was killed by the ADF as they retreated.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Goma against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. Police used tear gas to disperse the protest, which was banned, while the protesters threw stones, blocked roads and burned tires. At least one protester was also allegedly killed while trying to wrestle a rifle from a police officer, while 2 police and 5 protesters were wounded, and 20 people arrested.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The NDC-R were allegedly aligned with Nande fighters and were supported by young people from Lubero, with the fighting having been widely reported as ethnic violence between Nande and Hutu.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy

notes: MONUSCO carried out airstrikes on several ADF rebel positions with helicopters in Beni territory following an attack on one of their camps over the weekend. The UN forces said they had tracked down the rebels that had attacked them on Nov.29-30.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
source: Radio Okapi; AP; Xinhua; MONUSCO; Le Potentiel
notes: ADF rebels dislodged FARDC soldiers from at least part of Eringeti on Nov.29 before being pushed out a few hours later on Nov.30. The rebels attack stretched from Makembi to Eringeti and simultaneously targeted a FARDC position, a MONUSCO base, a hospital in Eringeti, and the office of the PNC in Beni territory. 1 UN peacekeeper, 7 soldiers, 10 civilians and 21 rebels were killed, while 1 peacekeeper and 4 soldiers were injured. 5 more people believe to have been killed during the fighting were found a few days later. During the violence at least 43 homes were also burned. At least 2,000 people ahve fled following the fighting.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR forces counter-attacked NDC-C forces in Bukumbirwa following an assault by the armed group the day before. Numbers of fatalities were uncertain (coded as 10). Other reports stated that NDC-R forces were the ones who pushed them out.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: A coalition of Mayi Mayi Militias, including Kiyandayira from Lubero, Mayi Mayi Handlebar from Walikale, and NDC-R have pushed out FDLR forces from Buleusa, Kateku, Kanune, and Bukumbirwa. Casualties were not reported.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: A coalition of Mayi Mayi Militias, including Kiyandayira from Lubero, Mayi Mayi Handlebar from Walikale, and NDC-R have pushed out FDLR forces from Buleusa, Kateku, Kanune, and Bukumbirwa. Casualties were not reported.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: NDC-C fighters attacked FDLR positions in the Walikale area, pushing them out of a village (not named) and forcing them to retreat to Buleusa. Numbers of fatalities were uncertain (coded as 10).

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Cmdt La Fontaine)
notes: Local residents say that Mayi Mayi Lafontaine militiamen are in control of the Mbwavinywa region.

actor1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)

actor1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Police arrived and fired shots into the air to disperse the rioters.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 16 July. On 15 and 16 July, FRPI elements allegedly raped three women and two girls at Koni village near Aveba.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Residents of Aru demonstrated against measures aimed at reducing barriers around Vura on the border between the DR-Congo and Uganda.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Hundreds of people staged a peaceful march against the suspension of flights by Ethiopian Airlines.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 9 civilians were killed by gunfire and machetes by suspected ADF rebels in Kakuka, 60km Nord-east of beni. 69 houses were also burned, and 2 hostages taken.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked an IDP camp in Gety, where they raided several properties in the settlement. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Kampala Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Security Measures: Residents of Walikale have begun to set up popular self-defense groups, including the village of Kampala (lat/longs not available), allegedly due to the failure of police and military to protect civilians.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A FARDC soldier and a motorcyclist were killed during an ambush by ADF rebels along the Mbau-Kamango road.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 10 people were kidnapped in a raid by APCLS and Nyature Mayi Mayi militiamen in the areas of Biriba, Bukondo and Bahimba in the Walikale territory. The attackers also looted property.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 10 people were kidnapped in a raid by APCLS and Nyature Mayi Mayi militiamen in the areas of Biriba, Bukondo (lat/longs not available, grouped at Walikale) and Bahimba in the Walikale territory. The attackers also looted property.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen raided the town of Songolo, firing shots into the air, breaking into houses, and stealing property. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Over 3,000 gold miners who were forcibly evicted by police protested in the streets of Mungwalu, about 80km from Bunia. They protested against the actions of the police and Mungwalu Gold Mining (MGM) whose behalf they acted upon.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: Victims of a gunman who tried to rob a place of mourning stole his gun and shot and killed him.

actor1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
notes: Mayi Mayi NDC Cheka and Handlebar militiamen clashed over the weekend around some hills in the Ihana area. 14 militiamen were killed, primarily Cheka, while 8 were wounded on both sides.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: UPC: Union of Congolese Patriots
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Republican Guard
notes: Between 5-8 people were killed, including 1-4 FARDC soldiers (anonymous source in the Republican Guard claims 4 according to AFP) and 4 assailants, and several wounded, during an attack by heavily armed suspected UPC gunmen on Goma airport. 3 gunmen were also arrested. The attackers were believed to be attepting to rob supply depots at the airport, as well as potentially an arms depot, while another source claimed the gunmen were associated with an unidentified rebel movement created by Mbusa Nyamwhisi (later sources point to UPC involvement as well). At least one of those killed was a member of the Republican Guard. The assailants were then chased into Goma town by the FARDC soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: Movement of forces: About 200 Ugandan soldiers have reportedly crossed into DR-Congo in the Ruwenzori area and settled into several villages, including Kalehaleha, Kalindera (coordinates approx) and Mumbiri (coordinates approx). They continued to be in the area as recently as Apr.24. The Ugandan government denies its forces have entered the DR-Congo.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A DR-Congo government spokesman said that about 300 Rwandan soldiers made an incursion into Nord-Kivu which was repelled by FARDC soldiers, resulting in one FARDC member wounded. The Rwandan soldiers had been encamped at Musangoti Hill in Virunga National Park and retreated across the border after the clash. The Rwandan representative to the UN has denied the events, although park rangers and local residents have confirmed the incursion occurred.

The attack was repelled after 2 hours, during which time one FDLR rebel was captured and one killed.

They also say 237 FDLR rebels have been neutralized in total, of which 13 have been killed (fatalities covered in previously coded events).

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

notes: 1 woman was raped by FRPI fighters during an attack on Talolo village.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Residents of Nyanzale report the return of the FDLR to the area after the departure of FARDC.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Residents of Nyanzale locality say that they have been the victims of reprisals by FDLR fighters who have returned to the village following FARDC operations in the area, including looting, kidnapping, rape, extortion and killings (coded as 10).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Militiamen attacked a FARDC vehicle, severely injuring a soldier and damaging the vehicle. Reports conflict about whether they are part of the FRPI or another militia group.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: ADF rebels attacked 3 villages in the Beni area, killing 4 civilians with machetes. The rebels allegedly killed the civilians while attempting to escape an ongoing FARDC offensive.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Lucha activists engaged in a sit-in outside the office of the governor of Nord-Kivu in Goma to demand the release of members of their organization arrested on Sunday in Kinshasa.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Some sources claim 3 people died during the incident, while the administrator of the territory said that one person was seriously wounded and there were no deaths.

Students were present during the protests.

actor1: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
notes: NDC militia fighters made an incursion into Kasugho. They looted and burned house and injured 4 people. The UNOCHA reported this, saying that the NDC have become more active in the Lubero area around Fatua and Lasugho recently.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Students demonstrated against the decision to cut internet access and SMS messaging. They established barricades and set fire to tyres. Police fired live bullets and tear gas to disperse demonstrators. One student reported injured. A butcher was killed by a stray bullet. Elsewhere in Goma police opened fire on protesters in Goma and used tear gas to repel rock-thowing youths. Three deaths reported.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Protests against the proposed electoral law reported in Nord-Kivu on 20th January 2015.

assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Clashes occur between demonstrators, who threw stones, and the police during protests against the proposed electoral law. The crowd also attacked two MONUSCO peacekeepers, injuring one. Some demonstrators were wounded and others arrested alongside opposition political leaders, including Rubens Mikindo, federal leader of the Union for Social Progress and Democracy [UDPS] in the east; Christian Badose, Ecide partys spokesman; Leon Tembo, Federal Chairman of the Union for the Congolese Nation [UNC] in the east and Jean Baptiste Kasekwa, Ecide partys executive secretary in eastern DRCongo.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Fighting began between FARDC soldiers and FRPI militiamen in the village of Aveba, and spread to other villages in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi (in Ituri), including Tchekele, Kaswara and Bavi. Thousands of people were displaced during the fighting. In Aveba, UN helicopters assisted the Congolese forces, and at least 14 FRPI and 6 FARDC soldiers were reported dead in Aveba.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: In Aru Territory, Ituri District, police have announced that two people were killed and about 15 houses set on fire at Edipe village, 260 km Nord- of Bunia town, in mid-week by rival community of Adumi village. Police stated that this happened after residents of Edipe village killed a man of the rival village of Adumi whom they accused of raping a married woman in her twenties from their village.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC: Armed Forces of DRC (2003-) clash with the Federal Republican Forces (FRF) in high plateaux of Minembwe [eastern Nord-Kivu province]. The government troops recaptured two FRF stongholds and a FDLR stronghold in the area. (unspecified exactly where)

actor1: Military Forces of Southern Sudan (2005-2011)
notes: The administrator of Aru Territory in Ituri District [Nord-eastern Orientale Province] reported that troops of the Sudan Peoples Liberation Army [SPLA] have occupied two villages in Kengezi area near the border between DRCongo and Southern Sudan. He stated that troops of the armed forces of Southern Sudan have built their military barracks in Kimba Village, 200 metres inside DRCongo territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Southern Sudan (2005-2011)
notes: SPLA accused of forcefully occupying part of Kengezi-Base Village in this Nord- eastern part of DRCongo forcing Congolese police officers to abandon the border post and retreat further inside Congolese territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 15 January in Nord-Kivu, armed militia stole a truck belonging to a humanitarian organization and then used it for a violent assault on aid workers in the Muhanga IDP camp in a bid to steal their belongings.

actor1: FPJC: Popular Front for Justice in Congo
notes: Residents of eight villages, located about 100km southeast of Bunia town, have fled following an attack by the Popular Front for Justice in Congo militia group last night.

actor1: FPJC: Popular Front for Justice in Congo
notes: Popular Front for Justice in Congo attacked eight villages in Zunguluka area. They stated that during this attack churches, health centres, schools and houses were completely destroyed.

actor1: FPJC: Popular Front for Justice in Congo
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FPJC killed six people, including two soldiers of the Armed Forces of DRCongo, destroyed a military camp near Boga location, abducted several civilians and set many houses on fire during the attack.

actor1: FPJC: Popular Front for Justice in Congo
notes: Popular Front for Justice in Congo [FPJC] attacked Muhani village, some 65 km southeast of Bunia town [east], on the night of Monday, 05 January 2010.
